title: Ethereum developers set roadmap for an eventful 2024 - CryptoSlate
summary: Ethereum developers have outlined a comprehensive plan for the network's development in 2024, including significant upgrades and new proposals. Key focuses include the deprecation of the Goerli testnet, the activation of 'Dencun' in January, and the introduction of a new proposal to enhance the power of Execution Layer (EL) clients. Other notable developments include the creation of a Meta Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) for Dencun and the preparation for the Prague/Electra network upgrade. The Ethereum community is encouraged to participate in these technical discussions and express their preferences for potential features in the upcoming upgrades.

title: Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Dogecoin All Jumped This Week - The Motley Fool
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Bullish sentiment is driving the momentum, with factors like the stock market's "risk-on" move and increased liquidity from airdrops contributing. However, the market's reliance on speculation and lack of solid use cases raise concerns about sustainability. As such, investors may want to take profits after a strong week and month.

title: Ethereum Devs Aim to Activate Dencun in January 2024 - Unchained - Unchained
summary: Ethereum developers agreed to activate the Dencun upgrade on the testnet in January 2024, if things go as planned. The upgrade will be the last-ever upgrade on the Goerli testnet, which will stop being supported by the Ethereum client and foundation testing teams. The developers recommended coordinating a hard fork as soon as they return from the holiday break, assuming no major bugs are discovered in clients on Devnet 12. The upgrade will include several Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs) listed in a new Meta EIP document created by the protocol support lead. The final item on the agenda was planning for the Prague/Electra network upgrade, which will require changes on both the Execution Layer and Client Layer.

title: What Is Shiba Inu (SHIB) in Cryptocurrency, and How Does It Work? - Investopedia
summary: Shiba Inu is a cryptocurrency that was created in 2020 as a parody or alternative to Dogecoin. It features a Shiba Inu dog breed as its mascot and has gained popularity due to its low price and the ability to purchase a large number of tokens with a small amount of money. Shiba Inu has a limited utility and use case as of 2023, but its community is working to develop and improve it. The cryptocurrency is highly volatile, and its price can fluctuate significantly. While some trades in Shiba Inu have resulted in significant gains, investing in it carries risks, and it is not recommended for all investors.

title: Will Ethereum Flip Bitcoin in 2024? VanEck Weighs In - Watcher Guru
summary: In a new report, investment firm VanEck predicts that Ethereum will not overtake Bitcoin in 2024, despite expected gains. The report suggests that Bitcoin will maintain its position as the largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization due to its clear regulatory status, higher energy consumption, and potential state-level support from countries like Argentina. Ethereum is expected to outrun mega-cap tech stocks, but will not surpass Bitcoin in market cap. The report also mentions that Ethereum may lose share to other smart contract platforms like Solana.

title: ETH Price Hits 18-Month High, Ethereum Dencun Hardfork Coming By January 2024 - CoinGape
summary: Ethereum (ETH) price has reached an 18-month high, trading at $2,375 with a market cap of $285 billion. Investors have set price targets of $3,500. On-chain data shows that non-exchange wallets are holding an all-time high of 54.6 million ETH, while exchange wallets have dropped to a 5-year low of 9.3 million ETH. The upcoming Dencun hardfork in January 2024 aims to significantly boost data availability for layer-2 rollups, leading to a decrease in transaction costs and improved scalability, security, and gas fees. The Ethereum Foundation recommends users to initiate the migration process in advance to ensure stability.

title: Ethereum, Under OFAC Pressure: Abundant Censorship - Cointribune EN
summary: Ethereum is becoming more centralized as 72% of its block builders are censoring transactions sanctioned by the US government's Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC), according to a report by CoinDesk. This is a significant increase from last November when only 25% of transactions were censored. The majority of the largest block builders on the network are filtering these transactions, with only one builder, Titan, opposing this practice. The move comes after OFAC targeted Tornado Cash, an Ethereum-based private mixing program, with a lawsuit. The US regulator aims to close down the tunnel through which stolen cryptos by North Korea's Lazarus Group and funds fueling terrorist organizations like Hamas or countries sanctioned by the US are being moved.
